Reviews.Title: “Good for a one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Cathynevza
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close, by walk, to the Central station in Amsterdam. The rooms were very small (not enough space to swing a suitcase) and the beds were all squashed together. There was no proper shower, and the bathroom was also very small. The TV remote was nowhere to be seen and during the night, all the sounds from the street kept us awake( we were in the basement rooms, which are newer but noisier). Upstairs, be warned, it is a shared bathroom. To conclude, if you get it for a cheap price and if it is only for short time, it is a passable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quentin arrive hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben i Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very freindly and helpful staff great location for getting into central amsterdam but a little loud and night time from the streets below,one of the cheapest places i have stayed in amsterdam but good value for whats there

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jess M
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I used this hotel for his 21st back in October 2011 and are going back at the beginning of June.After reading some reviews on here i was a little apprehensive, however, this accomodation was perfect for the purpose and for the expectations!If your looking for a cheap place to rest your head at night after exploring the delights of amsterdam, then you have booked the right place!yes it has steep stairs; as does everywhere in amsterdam!And yes the bedrooms are small with shared bathrooms, but it informs you on your booking that its shared bathrooms, so whats the problem?to top it off you can smoke in the rooms, and if, like us thats a big reason you go to amsterdam, then this hotel is perfect!Cant wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Except a very stone bed and the four stairs to climb, it was ok. Breakfast ok in a pleasant place, clean. The room was tiny but they always are in netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay (25.03.12 to 27.03.12)”
Reviews.Author: Adham S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient placed on the main walkway with all the shops & coffee shops running through the town centre, so you don't have to go far to find anything & its only 5 minutes away from Amsterdam Central Station. Would definately used again.

Reviews.Title: “Think hostel and you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: oleadam
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's location near the Central Station. The photos and website make it seem a bit grander than in reality it is. Though the foyer is very nice. Our room was very small and basic. We had booked a double but only got a twin room. We were told only twin rooms have their own shower so we were happy to have that room and not have to share a bathroom. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast were adequate and we were able to make toasties which was good. It was a nice location to stay as it is just 5 min walk from the main tourist areas, but a bit quieter and with some nicer coffee shops nearby. Probably would stay here again but only if not planning to spend much time in the room as it was so basic.

Reviews.Title: “In line with its peers, and not bad value”
Reviews.Author: ploughman8
Reviews.Content: I've probably stayed at 15 or so different hotels like this one inside the canal belt, and this one was very much in line with expectations, i.e. steep staircase, room not too much bigger than the mattress but with a small sink and a window looking out to the street, and the toilet and shower in separate small rooms down the hall. Reception was friendly. I had booked on Orbitz ("the death star"). On negatives observed, the walls can seem a bit thin if you're next to the room that sleeps 4 and they're in a talkative mood. Location is a big plus, as it's walkable from Centraal Station in about 10 minutes as long as you're not too heavy on bags. This makes it good for overnight layovers, as the round-trip from Schiphol is only 8 to 9 euros and the trip takes maybe 25 minutes, with frequent service. I needed to get back to the airport by 8 a.m. the next day and had no problem. It's also in a party area of town, judging by the nature of the businesses nearby. You need only cross the street for the nearest coffee shop, for example. Porn, mushrooms, raunchy souvenirs and space cakes also seem to be well-represented though, to be fair, it quiets down at night and doesn't have the pedestrian visitor traffic (nor the windows) like the red light district does. So maybe it's party-lite, OK for those seeking such, tolerable for other adult visitors seeking a convenient location, but unsuitable for families. All in all, a typical sort of Amsterdam hotel experience in a handy location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hannah T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good price, get what you pay for, basic rooms perfect location and very helpful and friendly staff on reception. Rooms seemed clean but bathroom and shower was a bit dingy, would be better to have an en suite

Reviews.Title: “Fine for price”
Reviews.Author: DanPMG
Reviews.Content: Excellently located budget accommodation. It's decidedly rough around the edges but got plenty of quiet nights sleeps and seemed pretty clean. Stayed in an en suite triple room with 2 mates.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time at the Quentin arrive!”
Reviews.Author: Aisling K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 4 nights, we only paid for the room we didn't bother with breakfast! The hotel is way better than what I expected after it being so affordable, we had a nice small room overlooking the street, room was just what we needed two basic but very comfy beds and a sink and mirror! Had no problems with the shared bathroom it was always free! The woman on reception was lovely and very helpful! The staircase can be a bit daunting if you have a large suitcase like we did but it's not too bad! Perfect location on the haarlemmerstraat

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: AllanMauro
Reviews.Content: If I go to Amsterdam again, I'll stay in this Hotel again. Good staff, clean room and nice place (very close to Amsterdam Centraal, about 5 minutes walking).

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Quentin Arrive!”
Reviews.Author: edward r Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A clean room with two beds and central location, on a tight budget. That is what we required....and the 'Quentin Arrive' delivered perfectly. OK....so the rooms are basic.... no jacuzzi, no water-bed, no snooker table. Let's keep it real....You're in Amsterdam guys.... in a clean, well managed hotel, for around Â£20 a night. There's a couple of very comfortable beds, two chairs, and a convenient little table :-) What more do you need? The reception area is inviting, with comfy seating, coffee/tea and big windows. The friendly, helpful staff are full of local knowledge and useful tips. Free wi-fi internet is available too, if you need it. 5 minutes walk from the train station, less than 10 minutes from 'Dam Square'. Quality coffee shops and takeaway food on view from the room window. We had a great stay in Amsterdam. An absolutely stunning city. beautiful people.... beautiful architecture....beautiful museums....beautiful smoking laws. A massive thank you to the staff at the Quentin Arrive Hotel.... We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “3rd time not so lucky!”
Reviews.Author: hardstylehearts1874
Reviews.Content: The Quentin Arrive Hotel offers budget accomodation close to Centraal Station, it is situated in the quieter area of Haarlemmerstraat, less than a few yards from Popeye's, Dampkring, GreenHouse & Barneys all are highly recommended coffeeshops for the smokers out there, it is also only a 5 minute walk from the Red Light District & Dam Square. The staff at the hotel are helpful and polite, late check-ins aren't a problem. The rooms are very basic with a dark, depressing colour scheme, the last time we stayed we were greeted with only half a coat hanger in the wardrobe!! You've just got to laugh, The only plus side is they have a new swipe card security system in place for your door and the main entrance door. Good Points - Sell tea/coffee/cold drinks at reception -Smoker friendly Bad Points -Possible Bed Bugs/Itchy beds TIP- opt for private bathroom, room 101 is really noisey, 201 is on the ground floor

Reviews.Title: “Review on Quentin Arrive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donn Q Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel I was pleasantly surprised how nice the reception area was. The hotel is in the stages of refurbishment and I think the hotel will be very nice once all the refurbishment has been completed. our room was very basic, two beds a table and chair, we had upgraded to get private facilities, these were also basic. The room also had a TV. Can't complain about the celanliness of the room, the room was spotless. All staff that we spoke to were extremelly friendly. The hotel is in an ideal location for all major attractions. The area in which the hotel is located was friendly and felt very safe to walk in both during the day and at night. Central Station was a 5 minuite walk, all shops and restaurants were also about a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ewa s Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, few minutes from central station. Rooms are ok, basic standard, shared bathroom and toilets, but kept very clean. I had a room next to the street so it was a bit noisy. Service was ok, friendly. Would recommend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quentin arrive Birthday trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: John C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome!!! The staff were very helpful and friendly, although when we turned up we almost got charged double??!! Don't quite know what that was about but we had our booking conformation with us luckily!! But as I said the receptionist made a phone call and sorted it!! The location of the Quentin arrive couldn't be better as you have 4 coffee shop right outside the door î€Ž and it's only a 10min walk to Dam square and then not far to anywhere at all. The room was really good had T.V, sink, wardrobe and heating which was a big bonus as it was freezing outside!! We had 3 rooms in total and they were all great!!! Also.... Smoking rooms as long as you open the window!!! Shared toilets and showers are not as bad as they sound, they were always very clean and the hotwater was consistent in the shower. TIP if your staying with friends take your phone in the shower and give them a buzz when your done, then your not all waiting for other people:-) All in all the Quentin arrive gets a massive thumbs up and when we plan our next trip to Amsterdam this is the place we shall be stayingî€Žî€Žî€Žî€Ž

Reviews.Title: “It'll do for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: studiggler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a lads weekend. I cannot fault the location, it's just where you would want to be, not to close and not to far away from all the action. The rooms are just about passable but like I say after a weekend you want to come home to a decent bed and sheets. The price was just right for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not mutch for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Leif Roar H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, but building is old and not been upgraded for many years. The roms han no toilet or shower, you had to go to a shared toilet and shower room. Not so nice. And you could hear every sound from the other room over and beside you to, so the sleep was not so good. Breakfast was good thow.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: flavia186338
Reviews.Content: ok for what you pay, but too noisy (you can hardly sleep on the week end) and a bit smelly. would not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent :) Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: claire g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although very basic, this hotel was exactly what we needed! The hotel staff were so welcoming and friendly and we will definitely be staying here again! Thank you for making ourt first time to Amsterdam so amazing :)

Reviews.Title: “Feedback of hotel confition”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room heating system was ok but not put in the right location. I disliked the sink in the rooms as it was too odd. When the doorguest open their sink the noise of the heater disturbs so much. On average;the location is good. Breakfast superb but lack of toilrts in the rooms was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Our 4 night break in Quentin Arrive Hotel,Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: couple101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few nights and it was a great hotel with polite staff, clean rooms,private bathrooms, location is perfect for tourists,lots of supermarkets, shops and only 5 mins from amsterdam station. I recommend this hotel for anyone who is visiting amsterdam, but always put in mind that amsterdam is a small and old city so expect all hotel rooms to be abit small around amsterdam with small stairs so dont be surprised.

Reviews.Title: “a very good place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lydia s
Reviews.Content: DON'T listen to the bad reviews!! i read them before i left and was scared but me and my friend stayed hear for 3 nights and can safely say there is nothing we can complain about. apart from no lift, but i am a girl and i don't travel light and there is a lot of stairs to the 4th floor, but nothing was too much trouble for the cleaners in the mornings saw bathrooms and toilets get cleaned every day, staff was lovely to us. tiny room but you get what you pay for also BIG thumbs up as you can also smoke in the rooms :) will stay hear again soon :)) lydia x

Reviews.Title: “Best low cost hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy L
Reviews.Content: After a few terrible experiences at youth hostels, I've decided that low-cost hotels are the way to go. So, if you want a cheap hotel, there's no better low-cost hotel in Amsterdam than the Quentin Arrive. When I arrived I was immediately impressed with the lobby. It's spacious, luminous, and cosy. One could even consider it a cafÃ© since they do serve coffee and cupcakes. I've been to Amsterdam many times and have no trouble finding things to do, but after discussing with the receptionist who is also a city tour guide, I discovered even more fun and typical things to do. On top of all that, it's only a few blocks away from Central Station so that made it very convenient to get to the station in a hurry to catch my train. I'll definitely stay there the next time I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Quentin Arrive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsDallas
Reviews.Content: We have been to Amsterdam sooo many times everytime we chose to stay at different areas. October-2011 This is a friendly hotel..after the smoking laws to outlaw tobacco.. we were still permitted to smoke out of the window...NOT many hotles are relaxed enough to be able to do this. We found NO problems with this hotel, staff were friendly, This is an EXCELLENT HOTEL just a few steps from Popeye's cafe so no chance anyone in our party got lost hehe... Harlem straat is a great area for markets/shopping/bars/ would recommend this hotel to anyone... Just be careful as the stairs in Most hotels are very very steep. WE HAVE RE-BOOKED the same hotel 30th Jan 2012

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: 1paul123
Reviews.Content: For the price it good value I'd like to challenge anyone to find as good for the price not for the faint harted when it comes to climbing stairs no lift but not that bad if your fit and I'm 50 but if your doing amsterdam on the cheep this is the place all round good very central 5 minuets from dam square 2 minutes from the station and coach stops

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: Simmond
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights from 13 of oct. The walls had blood stanes and so did the sheets on one of the beds! We also came home coved in bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: phil n
Reviews.Content: stayed here on the 11 to the 13 of october 2011 what a dump room 210 is full of bed bugs an the bed sheets were filty only good point is you can smoke in the room aviod this place like the plauge

Reviews.Title: “We're going back for round 3, something must be right.”
Reviews.Author: hardstylehearts1874
Reviews.Content: After reading many a bad review me and my partner were rather nervous about our first visit to the Quentin Arrive, After a 2 minute walk from Central Station we arrived at the well presented reception of the hotel. We were an hour early for check in but the staff were more than happy for us to store our luggage in the room while it was getting cleaned. The room on our first trip was a standard room (shared shower & toilet) with a double bed, sink, television, 2 wooden chairs and a small cupboard for storage. The sharing of toilet & shower could not be faulted, the toilet was available everytime we needed to use it and the shower room was the same. someone attended to them everyday so stock of toiletroll etc was fine. You get what you pay for at this hotel and we certainly have no complaints. You can smoke (local produce) in the rooms aslong as the windows are open and coffee is available in the main lounge/reception. You can get breakfast upon request. The location is perfect, you are a 5 minute walk away from the main strips, Dam Square, Red Light District, Restraunts and hundreds of coffeeshops. Our second visit we tried out the En-Suite room with shower, toilet and sink. This did cost slighty extra but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jess M
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the hotel reviews i was a little anxious on arriving at the hotel, however i was extremely pleasently surprised!it was lovely, spacious and tidy downstairs, and the receptionist was very helpful!when arriving at my room (105) it was extremely small, and my partner and I felt a little disapointed.However this was very short lived once we opened up the curtains and saw the massieve windows and the extensie view!The hotel is in a excellent location!in fact, perfect for young travellers wishing to explore the city. There is at least four coffee shops within a 2 minute walking distance, and 3 pubs. Even though the hotel is in a reasonably busy place, the hotel itself is very quiet and you do not fee overwhelmed by noise and arent affected by the hustle and bustle! The location, staff and cleanliness, was brilliant! If you just want a somewhere to sleep at night, and dont spend too much time in your hotel, then this place is ideal!We thouroughly enjoyed are trip and would quite happily stay in the Quentin Arrive again when we re visit the city!

Reviews.Title: “Basic rooms with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MsBean2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the 4th floor. That room was very quiet altough the window was a little bit broken. Decoration was very basic and the walls were allmost like in prison, but beds, pillows and blankets were nice and soft. The room had everything we needed and expected. There was no elevator in the hotel and no breafast either. I wouldn't succest this hotel to eldery persons who like to have some peace, quiet and privacy. But if shared toilet and shower is no problem to you, you want your hotel to have an excellent location and do not want to spend too much time there, just sleep and go, this is your choise!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for our base camp!”
Reviews.Author: syntheticsolutions
Reviews.Content: after seeing the negative reviews across the website, i arrived at the hotel with a bit of doubt, this was short lived. the hotel reception was extremely clean with sofas to relax on and a range of drinks at the reception desk, the staff were very friendly and helpful when we were checking in. our room was on the 4th and top floor of the building and the stairs were in a typical dutch style (steep as hell). this didn't bother me at all but i can understand it being a problem for an overweight person or if you don't get up to much exercise. The building itself is beautiful, very clean throughout. as far as i know, most of the rooms have huge open windows looking out on the main street at the front or the lovely dutch houses out back which is where we were, our window view was amazing, it looked out over the rooftops of all the other buildings and cathedrals etc. The room was tidy, we got a twin budget, it was clean and fresh. there were a few burn marks in the sheet that had been cut out to make the sheet look a little tidier. When we checked in we were told no smoking in the room which was a bit gutting but understandable. The bin was emptied during the morning sometime but we were out, the towels were not but i was to understand that you were to take them to reception and ask for a new one. haarlemmerstraat is the most beautiful place ever! it is by far my favourite area in amsterdam, it is tranquil and civilised, there aren't so many bars so the noise stays at a decant level, the canals around here are really quiet and pretty. If you are going to amsterdam for a first time or are still exploring this city then you must stay in haarlemmerstraat. All in all i think this hotel is a great place to stay, it is cheap, friendly, in a great area and acts as a great base camp to explore this wonderful city, as for the missing bags, i'm sorry but only a fool would leave baggage with someone regardless if it was with a hotel, police, coffee shop or a drug addict, the point is keep your bags with you and this mistake wont happen, we did and everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price we paid !!”
Reviews.Author: lfod_cork
Reviews.Content: Myself and 7 of my friends stayed here in late July,,,,, and I must say we were rather nervous having read the reviews below!!! However there was no need to be .We arrived early around 11am and knew we did not want to leave our bags in storage as previous reviews have told of belongings being stolen.We had 2 rooms booked and as one was ready we were allowed to drop our belongings off , this was brilliant as it allowed us to go site seeing for the day!! The bedrooms were basic but just what we needed, the lobby was great to people watch and relax after a long day of walking and the location was perfect!! Even sharing the bathrooms was never a problem , not once did we have to wait for the shower!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great for cheap one night stay - don't expect too much though”
Reviews.Author: Kimmy130886
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one evening with my bf for a short break after a business trip. Is what it says on the tin - cheap and if you don't mind toilet and shower down the hall then really not that bad. Not as clean as I would have liked with a cigarette burn in the sheet and a few hairs on the bed really not worth the 75 GBP we paid. We warned though that is can be slightly noisey but then again what do you expect - it is Amsterdam! Also took forever to check in as there was one member of staff who seemed to be more interested in chatting on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, what u pay is what u get.”
Reviews.Author: uxeror
Reviews.Content: Service ok, helpful. Poor standard. Have stayed at youth hostels with better standard. But it is clean in spite of the low standard. Would I choose it again? Probably not. Would I take my girlfriend here? Only if I wanted her to break up!!!! If not , avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value though don't leave your luggage in the store!!”
Reviews.Author: brokensocialsteve
Reviews.Content: Nine of us stayed at the Quentin Arrive from the 2nd of June until the 5th for a Stag do. We found the rooms to be very basic but fine for the money. Beds soft but comfortable, rooms generally tidy but damp on the ceiling and cigarette burns on the sheets. My room in particular was quite noisy as it looked onto the road but I didn't have any trouble sleeping (probably because of the booze...). The bathrooms were pretty big and shower was nice and hot. Towels weren't replaced when we put them on the floor so I nicked them from the towel cupboard! Free Wifi but couldn't get it to work. The location was good, 5 min walk from the station, but a bit of a walk to the Dam Sq, Red Light, Liedsplein. Breakfast immediately around the hotel was pretty rubbish but if you turn left and walk over the bridge (quite a walk) there is a really nice deli / cafe on the right hand side opposite the supermarket. It's pretty cheap too. As mentioned in the title we had problems with our luggage which put a dampener on the hotel as a whole really. We arrived stupidly early for our hotel at 10am and couldn't check in until 2pm. The hotel said they had a luggage store though so we agreed to put our stuff there. It turned out it was through an unlocked door, down a dingy stairway into a horrible little room with a couple of backpacks in there already and a door marked staff only. (suggesting staff pass through there all the time). Alarm bells rang (we had been assured repeatedly nothing was ever stolen from there) but we left our stuff there. Well you can guess the rest. We came back and our bags had been opened and searched and my friends lost an ebook reader and an iPod. Yes it was our own fault for leaving valuables in there. Other groups had cases in there that had been gone through too. The attitude of the staff after the event was of shock which quickly turned to "well we said dont leave valuables" to "theres nothing we can do". When we asked them to call the police they were quite hesitant. Eventually they did but told us we had to go to the police station to make a statement and marked a place down by leidseplein ( a looong way away). We travelled down there but couldn't find the place, everyone told us the police station was up by the rail station (much closer to the hotel). Bit weird we were sent all the way down to leidseplein. In the end we found one in the Red Light district and managed to make a statement and get a crime number for insurance purposes. It certainly did spoil our opinion of what would have been a good value stay for the weekend. Sorry for rambling on!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID- Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: stephenmead
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel- the only thing and I mean the only thing it has going for it is the Location. The location is brilliant. However it ends there. The staff were unfreindly and rude. The room was awful, there were cigarette burn marks in the curtains and in the bed sheets. We were woken up in the morning by a banging on the door from a member of staff shouting if we were in our room? Obviously we were, otherwise we would have checked out. Our room even though it cost 120 euros was on the ground floor, right onto a very busy main street, and so we had constant people traffic throughout the night. It was horrible. However if your a backpacker with a budget and you dont care about where you sleep, but location is important, then go for it. Although im not sure 120 euros is budget wise, especially for what you get in return. Terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location,great value for money”
Reviews.Author: xtian074
Reviews.Content: Dont take too much notice of all the bad reviews,this is a great little hotel if your on a budget,we(3 lads)stayed 3 nights room is only basic but all we did was sleep in it and sit out on our little balcony and chill out looking over the rooftops of amsterdam(room 425) geting up to your room keeps you fit there are a lot of steps!! the shared bathroom and toilet were spottless and the shower is great what more could you want!!! the lounge downstairs is a great place to get a coffeeand use the free wi fi we had no problems with any of the reception staff and they were very helpfull, if your up in time for breakfast the popye cafe next door is great!! we will be using this hotel again it was just the ticket for a cheap trip to amsterdam!!!

Reviews.Title: “In 16 visits to the dam Quentin Arrives Service was the worse, Shocking Service!”
Reviews.Author: AndyMatchplay
Reviews.Content: I booked our Bed & Breakfast stay at Quentin Arrive 5 weeks before travel through Laterooms.com. Ive been to the dam many times over the last 10 years and experienced many different hotels, B&B's and guest houses. For me Quentin Arrive was the worsed by far. We new the Hotel was only 1 star but we just wanted somewhere cheap to stay that was close to Central station. The location was good but the service from the staff at Quentin arrive was very poor. When we made the booking through Laterooms.com we were not told that the hotel would take a Pre-authorization payment from my card 6 days before travel. The hotel took half of the overall cost from my card incase we didnt show. On checking in at the hotel we were asked for FULL payment of our stay. I queried this at reception explaining that they had already taken half the cost of the room 6 days previously. The grumpy receptionist went on to tell me this was a Pre-authorization payment and that it would be refunded to my card straight away. As i had all my money in Euro's and only had the other half of the cost of the stay on my card left one of my friends had to make full payment on his card on my behalf. Then after checking inn we asked what time breakfast was served the next morning. We were told that the hotel did not serve breakfast. We showed them our Laterooms.com Hotel booking confirmation which included breakfast for which we had paid extra for and the receptionist simply shrugged her shoulders and told us to come back later and talk about it then. At this point we were feeling confused, let down and wondering what on earth was going on. We were made to pay an extra 50% for the room and told the breakfast we had payed for did not exist. After complaining we were told they would honour our breakfast and the next morning we were again dissapointed to find a very basic continetal breakfast of longlife milk, bread, slice of ham, slice of cheese. We had to complain there was no butter and we were told they could not toast our bread either. Shocking! On the morning of checking out of the hotel i realised that the Pre-authorization had not yet been refunded to my card. After speaking with the Hotel Mangeress 'Mona' i was told that i had to ring my own Bank and ask them to stop the payment myself. I telehoned both my own bank & visa who explained to me this was not possible and only after the hotel had refunded my Pre-authorization payment would the money return to my bank account. I even asked my bank to explain this to 'Mona' on the phone for which they did. 'Mona' kept on blaming my bank and said that her Visa company had refunded my card. They had not! After a week of being back at home i have had to make several calls to both Laterooms.com, Quentin Arrive, Visa & my bank. All at a cost to me. Visa have told me that the Pre-authorization is pending and until they either refund or collect this money then there is nothing i can do about this. Both Visa and my Bank say that the Pre-authorization can be pending for up to 6 weeks. What a disgraceful way for a Hotel to treat its customers. The whole scenario has spoilt the trip. I just hope this review will warn others what may be install for them if they stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!....... Amsterdam is brilliant though”
Reviews.Author: KeeleyCork
Reviews.Content: We pulled up to the 'hotel' and realised the location was great... just as it said on the website.Unfortunately this was the only good thing about the place. Firstly, when we arrived we went to store our luggage in the hotel... they rudely directed us to the basement and told us basically to store our bags at our own risk.... Then when we arrived back at the hotel to check in at 2pm and we were told to wait 5mins as they were getting new locks. An hour and a half later we were let into our room. We also found we had to share Manky toilets and showers with four rooms!!! (Shower if u dare). There is absoluntely nothing nice about this hotel Then we went out for the night and came back at 11pm to be told the keys werent working and they had to send the 4 of us to another hotel miles down the road.... no P.J's, clothes, toothbrushes, make up....... Nothing. When we arrived back the next day looking like something the cat dragged in they showed no apologies or offered any compensation.... THIS IS THE WORST 'HOTEL' EVER.... little cafe next door POPEYE is fab though xxx

Reviews.Title: “Quentin arrive hotel amsterdam less than basic”
Reviews.Author: 187062Phil
Reviews.Content: were do i start first,the room was basic only 1 plug socket in the room the bathroom was clean enought staff were friendly enough,great location for the coffe shops,the down sides were the wardrobe was broken so had to live out of the suietcase,after the first day the sink drainige pipe fell off the sink but the staff were happy to fix it the same day we were out,every night there was constant buzzing nosie from out side which kept us awake all in all very basic if its just a place to sleep then go ahead. pros: smoking in room, cons: nosie from outside, only 1 plug socket, no kettle

Reviews.Title: “This place is the pits....”
Reviews.Author: oreilly82
Reviews.Content: Rude staff, stains all over the floors and wall of the staircase going up to the rooms. Filthy stained rooms,prison style showers and a general feeling that nothing left in you room was safe. After 11 happy visits to Amsterdam this is by far the worst place i have ever stayed in. Pay the extra and get somewhere else....it sucks that badly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,friendly staff and clean facilities-what more could you ask?”
Reviews.Author: ginjaninjaManchester
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend Joe went to Amsterdam slightly apprehensive from some of the reviews we had read. When we arrived the staff were very helpful and despite the room not being ready, they advised us to go and chill out in the dampkring coffee shop over the road and she would call us when the room was ready!! We had paid for an en-suite room on the ground floor, which was very clean and tidy and we were able to smoke in the room- a handy extra when its -12c outside!!!! Overall this hotel was excellent value and was quite well located for all the main sights. the staff were friendly and helpful and we had a great time -

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: volacolomba
Reviews.Content: Firstly I made the booking throughout an Internet site which charged me 30Â£ of commission, then after I booked I phoned the hotel to make sure that the reservation was in the system, the reservation manager got my call and I asked her if it was possible to have a twin because we were two guys and she said yes but the price would be different, she described the hotel rooms as very basic with not amenities or coffee facilities nothing at all so then I asked why should I pay for the upgrade if there are no amenities in the room?? She then told me that she could give me a discount of Â£30, and we agreed. Upon arrival they charged me straight away the 330Euros for my stay...they game a room on the basement floor with a window that was at street level so everyone could watching us Big Brother style....people parking the bikes, shouting, there was a coffee shop next door and the people inside could clearly see what we were up too......in the entire room there was only one plug and was not even fixed on the wall very dangerous....a tiny toilet..the room had the smallest wardrobe in the world and one table two chairs and the telly but no remote.....we asked at the reception to have the remote and they told me that I have to pay 30Â£ of deposit....so I obviously did not get the remote, because of the location of the room the wi-fi network had a very good signal in the room, but unfortunately for some reason was not working with my laptop, I went to the reception and none of them could fix my problem, the router was suppose to be restarted and they told me to ask tomorrow morning......The following day the manager was there and I asked if it was possible to restart the router and she said that was my laptop the problem, this person was extremely annoyed and rude, in fact I left the reception and I did not bother any more to ask about internet, I stayed 4 days and the room has never been cleaned, and the rubbish bin never emptied, I did not say anything at check out I left the key and goodbye, when I came home I wrote a complaint to the reservation manager which never reply to me, I had to call them again and spend more then an hour over the phone (International call) to explain all the issues at the hotel and I asked her if I could get a refund...she said that she wanted to have a chat with the staff and that she would have email me. but I ended up calling her again, when I did that she started to tell me that they were so kind to me to give me the early check in (which is not true because my plane landed at schipol at 17.00 check in time was at 4 and we got at the hotel in the evening) then she accused me that we were very noisy people (we used the room only to sleep and having breakfast) she told me that the receptionist complaint about us because apparently we shout at her when I asked her to have the pwd for the internet and she told me that was only for the people that taking a drink at the bar so I ordered 2 coffee 5Euros and she also called me liar, after all of this she even refused to give me the refund and she hanged up. I did not have great expectation of the hotel because of the bad comments on tripadvisor, but was a good location and we needed the hotel just to sleep, and relax because was my first visit in Amsterdam I would never ever either choose or recommend this place, they are unprofessional, incompetents. I personally working in an Hotel and I would never treat a guest in such a bad way. I'm very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not the ritz but its amsterdam!! i would stay here again with no hesitation...so kant be that bad”
Reviews.Author: AUDACITY89
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in lots of hotels guest houses ect and this is one that i didnt feel ripped off by the price and didnt feel like a squat. Lets face it amsterdam stair cases are very steep and the beds are long and narrow and the rooms usually stink of smoke lol, this hotel is 5 mins walk from central station and is at the heart of all the hustle and bustle...so ideal for saving on trams ect.. The lobby looks really nice and the rooms are clean. If i stay in amsterdam again on the cheap this is where id stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: suerowe10
Reviews.Content: We were fooled by the online pics, and when we got there, by the foyer. All good until you get your room. Paid up front, unfortunately. Turned out better to cancel out and lose money.

Reviews.Title: “Worst budget hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CatiminiFromParis
Reviews.Content: The only positive things were -the location, close to central station -the quiet Otherwise, this is hard to find a positive thing to say about this hotel. The price was cheaper than other hotels but the value for money was terrible, I had much better experiences in unpretentious backpackers. First, the rooms were not nice at all. I wonder when they changed the carpets and the curtains because they were very dirty. The decoration was ugly and absolutely not romantic at all. The rooms stank cold tabac. The staff was unpleasant and even rude with some customers. They clearly did not care about anything else than making money. Basic services were not even achieved : -3 common showers for about 35 rooms -no tap water in the room at busy times -toilets that were so small that you cannot seat but on the side if you want to close the door -very uncomfortable beds And I don't talk about "extra" services that you now commonly find in good hotels: -no luggage room where you can store your luggage on your departure day -no wifi in rooms and it did not even work in the common area (-and of course no breakfast) I hope that comments like mine will discourage people from going to that place, even if prices seem attractive. You'd better go to a good backpackers Then I hope that it will force owners of the Quentin Arrive hotel to lower their price or to take better care of their customers !!

Reviews.Title: “SLUM IN CITY CENTRE”
Reviews.Author: w8282
Reviews.Content: Before i go into detail i must say we were treated well by the staff who were very nice. Now lets get into the nitty gritty i believe this place to be a helth and saftey issue with its steep narrow stairs, no fire exit and no lifts. As for the rooms it felt as if i was spending a night in a prison cell, with the small box room grafftti on the walls, sink in the corner damp carpets shared bathroom and toilet. It may be that i was stoned but i think the wardrobe was bigger than the room. All jokes aside, if all your looking for is a place to crash for a few hours in the city centre it does the job

Reviews.Title: “OK - But not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: LiamRyan32
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Amsterdam, and decided to try save some money. Myself and partner arrived late in the afternoon and found the receptionist to be quite pleasant. The rooms are basic and a bit on the grotty side, we were street facing so we had huge windows that were nice to sit and look out of. The location is pretty good, in the city but no in the very center. Slept well despite the street noise. We didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel, we were out all day. No for everyone, on the grotty side but a cheap bed to sleep in

Reviews.Title: “its a dump more room in a prison cell”
Reviews.Author: francisthompson31
Reviews.Content: shared shower and toilet with what seemed like whole hotel.the noisiest hotel ive ever stayed in. when booking i do not think they use the actual photos of the room you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: david_great121
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a twin room. Shared showers and toilet, sink in room. Great value for the money. nice and clean,nice beds and spacious room. Loud when window was open and stairs are steep and can be a pain. But other than that I have no complaints. Grat hotel for people on a tight budget. Much better than i expected.

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sooandal-mk
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews we were nervous ... but nothing wrong with the hotel. It was clean and less than 10 minutes or so walk from dam square. When you book these hotels you know there is no lift, or en suite so why complain, if you want better then pay more. We were more than happy and just got back today after 3 nights there. As for the mice people have seen did they spend too long in the coffee shops ...........

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Great lobby, average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gould321
Reviews.Content: Really easy to find. Just a few minutes walk down from the station. As you walk in the lobby and reception looks 1st class. lots of nice seats, friendly staff and large tvs to watch. I'm 6ft3 and getting up the stairs to the rooms was quite fun. Very, very tight and winding. (But this is Amsterdam, where most places and about 15ft wide!) I was with 4 friends and we was all put in the same room. Literally just 4 single beds and a wardrobe. Views were nice, rooms were clean. There was a shared shower at the end of the corridor that i guess was ok. but there must have been a good 6-7 rooms on that level so 1st come 1st served for the shower and loo. 24 hour reception was great, 4 nice nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute bargain”
Reviews.Author: jackjourney
Reviews.Content: I was very suprised at how clean and tidy this place was after reading other peoples reviews on it. We went there early march so Amsterdam was freezing but the hostel had the central heating on all the time so it was excellent to return to after a night out. We were on the top floor - the fourth, there was no shower on this floor but you only had to nip to the third to use it and we never had to wait. I honestly can't understand why there are so many bad reviews on this place.. I had no complaints. Maybe if people had booked it and turned up expecting a 4* hotel with on suite and mini bar but then you wouldn't be paying 20 euros a night. Would recommend this place to anyone. 5 minuites from the train station where you can go to the airport for 4 euros.. if there actually is a ticket inspector.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: ScaryFish
Reviews.Content: Excellent little place - cafe downstairs is beautiful with chandelers, leather sofas and lovely atmosphere - we didn't ever sit in tho as too eager to get out and about. Room - 101 - hahahah yes we laughed. Was just off the lobby/reception at the bottom of the stairs. Twin beds pushed together, en suite with shower. Simple clean and more than enough for a base. There was allot of noise from the street and from other guests but this is hardly a shock! Comfy beds with clean warm bedding and heating on all the time so we were cosy even tho it was snosing. Can't really comment on staff as we only saw them to hand in key in morning and collect it in evening. Location - perfect - just outside the central zone of the city. Landed about 3.15 - we were in our room by about 3.45 give or take incuding catching train from airport (â‚¬3.80). Directions from the Hostel website very vague but we soon found it! Easier than they make it sound! Would recomend to anyome who wants a reasonably priced base to explore the city thats clean and simple in the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Rude to my wife and child”
Reviews.Author: hillwod
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 yo child arrived at the hotel earlier than myself and the receptionist would not let them into the room I had booked because they wanted the whole four day room fee up front. They left them waiting in the lobby until I arrived 4 hours later.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BristolSean
Reviews.Content: After reading so many bad reviews, we were expecting the very worst!!!!! we were met by friendly staff and given a room that was bright, clean and basic but totally sufficient for our stay. Location was perfect and our only complaint was that the hotel could have provided more bedding as we were cold overnight! on the whole i would definitely return and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a budget stay right in the centre of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “oh my god its disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: elkaytoday
Reviews.Content: we hadnt booked this hotel, we came to stay there by default. Arrived in amsterdam to find that the hostel we where originally booked for was closed due to a mice infestation. We were advised that Quentin Arrive was a nice hotel quite close to where we were already. We where absolutely exhausted because we had just been at a festival in Belgium, and just wanted an easy night before enjoying amsterdam. We found the hotel no bother, and the reception looked reasonable. Cheap chandeliers, old leather sofa, dodgy painting but you could see what they where attempting to do on a budget. We spoke to the receptionist. The entire time we stayed here none of the receptionist looked in the least bit interested, they where rude, non attentitive and i dont think i seen one of them crack a smile. We where given the the keys to our room (2 single bed), no lift, had to drag luggage up 4 flights of the dodgiest stairs ever. The further we got to the top the worst the hotel looked. It was depressing. Our room was hideous but kind of clean. Im trying to find something positive to say about the room...Theres a good selection of channels on the tv. the 1 toilet for the whole of the fourth floor was in a broom cupboard. honestly it was the tiniest thing ive ever seen. The shower was located on the third floor- so two floors shared 2 toilets and 1 shower. the shower was reasonable- but the floor in it was full of hairs and grainy things under foot. its giving me the boak just thinking back to it. At night we had mice running about our room. the only positive thing about this hotel is its location- close to the train station for a quick get away never ever again dont put yourself through it

Reviews.Title: “Quentin Arrive”
Reviews.Author: ama20
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location!!! Good Service. Found the hotel clean and tidy. Apart from the little family of mice we had in room. Only came out when heating was off! the stairs are a killer. We were on 3rd Floor. What a mission. Would definitley go back. Great price. Paying for location. Would recommend. (if you dont mind mice.)

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER! Beware of BUG INFESTATION!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kmjfd
Reviews.Content: Wow..there are no words to describe how horrible this place is. My husband and I still can't get over how terrible our experience was. We booked our hotel on the advice of freinds who had stayed in the triple room upstairs only some few months prior. We booked online and paid the most for this room than any other room we had booked in Europe (over 12 different hotels). This one was the most expensive, and the most disgusting! When we arrived, the hotel was under construction, so we had to enter through a side door into a makeshift reception area. Once we checked in, we went up to our room. We had a double room with a private bathroom -- you opened the door to the room, and there were a set of stairs, making the room just above the makeshift reception area -- beside the stairs leading to the rest of the hotel. Rather than a double bed, we had 2 twins pushed together. Although not what we had paid for and not what was on our booking sheet, it was alright. However, the sheets were stained and smelled horrible. The room was tiny -- barely able to maneouver around the two beds. The noise was incredible -- so loud -- at all hours of the day and night (partly because we were directly above the reception area). The washroom in our room was the worst part of the entire hotel. To this day, the thought of it makes me want to vomit. It smelled so strongly of mold and the shower curtain was almost black. I could not shower without holding my breath. It was absolutely horrible. The toilet smelled like sewage, and there were bugs EVERYWHERE in the bathroom -- looked like fleas. When you flushed the toilet, even more bugs came out. It was absolutely horrible. So disgusting. The hotel, however, was a short walking distance from the central train station. It was in a convenient location to walk all around Amsterdam, but a bit sketchy at night, as it is a little bit out of the central area and on a poorly lit street (especially using the side entrance during construction). I would NEVER stay in this dump again, nor would I recommend it to anyone -- not even my worst enemy. The hotel had no internet access, no restaurant, no cafe, nothing. Just a room.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty, basic, expensive infested hotel but think we got off lightly.”
Reviews.Author: scarymango
Reviews.Content: On reading other customer reviews and looking at the pictures taken by guests I now think I got off lightly. We were pleased when we saw the reception area as it was pretty cosy and looked quite plush in terms of what we were expecting. The reception staff were OK if a bit dim, when I asked the lady at the counter of this was the 'quentin arrive' hotel she looked confused and said 'no.....oh wait, yes' (after looking at my confirmation) then took ages to process it whilst quietly arguing with herself. We also didn't mind the steep winding staircase to get to our room on the second floor - my partner won't go in a lift anyway. That's about as good as it got. The room was an average size but quite grotty, the floor was completely uneven I dread to think what we may have found under the carpet but it felt un-secure and bumpy. The bed was fine, cover had a couple of marks on it so I slept without it - fortunately it was warn enough to do so. The pillowcases were clean but the pillows inside were discoloured, from smoke I imagine. We've paid much less and got en suit everywhere else we stayed so weren't too pleased to realise that it was shared toilet/shower facilities but suppose we should have checked what we were booking. The toilet was OK at best but in the evenings it was accompanied with sick, roll up ash and suspect smells. The shower room was dank and smelt of mould but the actual shower itself was fine except the door handle came off in my hand. The door handle for our room was rubbish we feel lucky we weren't robbed. It was quite an effort and took some skill to actually look the door and when locked it didn't not feel secure in the slightest. Also the doors were all quite heavy and slammed which was noisy when you have people going back and forth to go to the toilet. In the morning we were awoken by a loud discussion by 2 staff about cleaning the toilets - least they were cleaned I suppose. Whilst I didn't see or hear any mice like other guests I did see the aftermath. I left a bag of cereal bars on the floor and at first thought I'd damaged them by putting a bag or something on top of them ripping the bag and wrapping, causing crumbs all over the floor. Of course when all the crumbs disappeared & I found lots of other holes in wrappers yet pieces of wrappers remained all over the floor this left little to the imagination. Yes the hotel is indeed infested with mice, even on the second floor. It wasn't that cheap in comparison to other better places we've stayed and I can't recommend it to anyone, except perhaps people looking to get stoned so that they might not notice their surroundings. There are nicer, cleaner places - avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “ROBBING [--]”
Reviews.Author: sarahchips
Reviews.Content: i booked a room with this hotel and had no confirmation booking email back and no reply to my email that i had booked and when i called them up they said i had not booked. i was left with no other option but to book with another hotel but the quentin arrive hotel took Â£60 out of my account for nothing. i have emailed these people and have called them up but i have NOT GOT MY MONEY BACK OF THEM I AM IN THE PROCESS OF TAKING THEM TO COURT BECAUSE I AM SICK OF THESE SCAMS. if anyone would like to resolve this they can contact me on my email address at sarahchips@hotmail.co.uk. This was booked last year and i have still not heard anything back from this hotel i was given an email address [--] but received NOTHING BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: danielm88
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a great location, about a 5 minutes' walk to the centraal station and it's cheap. Unfortunately this is pretty much all the Quentin Arrive has going for it. I only had the pleasure of staying the night, but it was enough.The reception was deceivingly pleasant (however the staff were not too welcoming). After a hike up the very steep staircase, I arrived at my room which had a large vomit stain on the carpet outside. The room itself was very simple, as expected. the sheets were clean at least. The TV didn't work and the room I was subjected to was next door to the boiler room! The communal bathroom had a worryingly sticky floor! and there seemed to be a lot of noise from the street below, this was on the top floor! I escaped early the next morning at about 6:00 am and I won't be returning. Overall this hotel is probably ok for singles for a night or two. Definitely not recommended for couples/families or If you are planning on staying longer than a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “'What a horrible place'”
Reviews.Author: Pinklfc
Reviews.Content: What a horrible place. First of all because we questioned the fee that was charged online and they made us wait over 2 hours until we could go into the room, the room was apparently being cleaned. When we could eventually go up to the room it was on the 4th floor, we had to lug our cases up there because there was no lift. when we arrrived we were appalled by what we found, bunk beds with a hard wooden base which were falling apart, the single bed was even worse, with blood stains on the sheets, fleas, which bit my friend and dare i say it, pubic hairs. We moved the bed over a touch so that we could open the window wide and to our disgust found toenails on the already filthy carpet. There were 4 lights on the wall and only one had a fixed shade around the bulb, the others were just exposed wires. There were big black stains on most of the walls and the TV did not work. The shower was one floor below us, however the toilet was on the same floor and my nose actually touched the door when i sat on it, it was that small. We had a balcony, which when we climbed out of to take a look at the view, nearly collapsed as the floorboards were shaky and uneven. We complained straight away and asked for our money back, we were told that we could only get refunded for 2 nights and had to pay for the first, so we stayed, bearing in mind that we put our towels over the stained pillow covers and bed sheets and lay on top. The next day the receptionist pretended he knew nothing about our discussion of the refund so we had to fight tooth and nail to get our money back, however we did and found a lovely little guesthouse two minutes from central station. I would definately not recommend this deathtrap to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: jonahStoke
Reviews.Content: i have just spent four days on a stag do with ten friends at the quentin arrive. the hotel is in an excellant location just 5 mins walk from the train station .you get what you pay for, a standard room with basic facsilities. the communial showers and toilet were very clean and easily accessable. i would recommend it for younger people but not the elderly as the stairs are very steep. there is no dining room or bar but none of us were up early anyway as we didnt get in till 6-7 most mornings

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sarai_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights, 2 in a double and 1 in a triple. The double was clean with enough room for 2 people. We shared a shower; its floor was a little dirty, but it didn't really bother me. In the triple, we had our own shower and bathroom and the shower was cleaner than the other one. The hotel has no frills but it's in a great location, only a 5-minute walk from the train station, and is only 70 euros for a double and 100 euros for a triple.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints, I knew it was a value room”
Reviews.Author: jowen001
Reviews.Content: I am truly surprised by all of the negative reviews. I may have been lucky not to have those experiences. I booked the room for 2 nights knowing it was a budget hotel. So the room was small, with few appointments and no decoration. That's what I expected for the price. The shower down the hall was kept clean while we were there, and everything worked just fine. The bed was comfortable. There was cable TV, a nice window shade, and the large window opened right up to a nice view of the street below. The carpet was old, but I didn't notice any explicit stains and the room did not smell bad at all. The staff was friendly and helped up find some out of the way attractions and pubs. The stairs are narrow and steep, but they are at least a century old. There are lots of stairs in amsterdam like that. The lobby was very nice and they served good coffee. I would stay there again, and I would hope that my experience was typical, rather than exceptional. I have stayed in some real dirt bag motels in my time, and the Arrive outshined them in every way imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “Goood Cheap Hotel...VERY worth it!”
Reviews.Author: biggulpatm
Reviews.Content: Very good location! Check in was no problem, room was very small as I had expected, bed was very comfortable and clean. Cable TV in the room was very nice. Shared bathroom down the hall, clean. I highly recomend this hotel for any younger travlers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Joegle
Reviews.Content: Having read the other comments here I was dreading the hole that we were going to find. Viewing the scaffold strewn reception area didn't reassure me either. We had two rooms because there were five of us and both of them were really nice. The man on the desk, who had a certain sleazy charm but proved trustworthy, told us that they had renovated the rooms and the reason for the scaffold in reception was because the last stage of the re-fit was there. I would stay at the Quentin Arrive again.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: thatgirl101
Reviews.Content: This place was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Broken light fittings, bare wiring, dirty! And in the bathroom URINE actually started to drip through the floor above onto the floor! Not nice! The whole place seemed dodgy and the people at the front desk were completely unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “much better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: dave999909084
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nites with girlfriend. Room was very small, but very clean, bathrooms were very clean and had plenty of hot water. Bed kinda caved toward the middle, but not too badly. Had big windows that open all the way,and no problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Quentin Arrive. The Worst Hotel I have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: WOTITIS
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? This is without doubt the worst 'hotel' I have EVER experienced, and I have tried a few budget hotels in my time. The check in was deceptively pleasant. A nice lady with efficient and polite customer service. It was downhill from there. The single room was small, as expected, but what I didn't expect was the smell of vomit & urine and the filthy, stained and dangerously dirty carpet. The curtain was hanging off of the rail by a couple of hooks and although it had a basin in the room, I shudder to think of how many people had used it as a urinal. DISGUSTING!! I sat for a few moment with my head in my hands, wondering what brought me to this incredibly rank place, and then reality struck and I realised I have got standards. I immediately booked into a better hotel and returned to ask for a refund. NO CHANCE. The 'boss' told me their 72 hour cancellation policy meant I would not get a penny! 72hours? This does not allow for unhappy guests. AVOID this [--] at ALL costs. I would rather eat glass. Ignore my advice at your peril!!. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: mike_puse
Reviews.Content: As we stepped into our room we were assaulted by an intense smell of vomit. Windows were not closing well. The moquette on the floor was dirty and completely stained. Choose this only if it's you last chance to find a place to stay in amsterdam.The photos are not corresponding to reality. Stairs totally unsafe and claustrophobic. Shared toilettes are cleaned once(maximum twice) a day. In general:disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Well at least it's cheap!”
Reviews.Author: BigRed
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the the Quentin Arrive in April '06 as a group of 7 guys and girls on a weekend break from work over 4 days. The hotel itself was very easy to find and the female member of staff who booked us in was very friendly and helpful, her male counterpart wasn't quite such a joy to deal with and seemed to get annoyed by even the simplest query! We had three rooms between us, 2 triples and a double. The triple I stayed in was exactly as the "accomodation" page of the hotels website shows. Three single beds, a sink, a TV and not much else. The windows were huge and the room was bright and would be quite nice if they spent a bit of money on paint and carpet. The beds were grotty and the carpets and furniture were in dire need of attention. The room was served by a communal shower and toilet that were both pretty grimey. The room itself was fairly insecure and it was a lengthy process just to get the door locked!! There are no safe facilities in the room and the reception offered no similar service either. There was an interesting array of stains around the room which I imagine was supposed to be "decor" but became an interesting conversation piece anyway. The other triple, on the 2nd floor I believe, had bunk beds and a single and was small and dingy with little light or air. The double wasn't as bad and had a small rickety balcony which only Evil Knievil would dare to climb out onto. The hotel is well situated and is a short jaunt from the central rail station if you can avoid the psychotic cyclists that will make every effort to mow down anyone with a suitcase! While I don't paint a horrifically bad picture of the place that's probably because I only spent 12 hours in the actual hotel during our stay and the time I was there was spent asleep. This is by far the scabbiest hotel I've ever stayed in, but it's also by far the cheapest. It's certainly in hostel territory rather than hotel. I would not recommend that lone travellers stay there as the rooms are so insecure and I doubt the staff would be very sympathetic/helpful if you got robbed. In summary the Quentin Arrive is a flea-pit of a hostel but the overwhelming factor is that they are very cheap and conveniently located. This combination clearly works as they are consistently well booked, I doubt many of those booking are repeat visitors though. If you are going to Amsterdam to enjoy the nightlife and won't be spending long in the room, don't mind showering in a grubby shower with no locks on the door and you have good travel insurance then your search for a hotel is over. Otherwise I'm sure you can find cleaner places for the same money, or safer for slightly more.

Reviews.Title: “Fire hazard?”
Reviews.Author: benito12345678
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming quality of this hotel was its location. You could also sleep on the street and have a good location. It was dirty, staff was discourteous and incomptetent, no security, maitenance was basically none. There was exposed wiring, windows that wouldn't shut, no curtain to draw over the window, and a teeny tiny staircase that would have prevented escape in the event of a fire. Photos on venere.com are deceiving. The room looks nothing like the photo posted

Reviews.Title: “Hotel you don't want to Arrive too”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if this was the last available place in the whole of the Netherlands and you had little money. Where shall i start? The Bathroom - shower head repeatedly came off, toilet didn't flush properly, no plugs in either bath or sink and there was a hole in the ceiling through which i'm sure i saw things move past. The Bed - it was ok. The Rest of the Room - dirty carpet, some type of sandy stuff on the floor, no hangers in the cupboard, curtains half hanging of the railings, door was impossible to lock. The surrounding area - to be honest this isn't a fault of the hotel, but it does get very noisy from passing traffic or general people, it is relatively central with a decent amount of shops nearbye. Further - the steps were a 'mare to go up and down on. In conclusion - if the hotel was improved in several small ways like a fresh lick of paint, some new carpet etc i would possibly consider it again, it just needs a bit of investment which it clearly hasn't got.

Reviews.Title: “A slum of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had prebooked and stayed on the first floor. the whole place had an air of terminal decline, rooms were filthy with stains gathered into some sort of art work. I had to share toilet facilities which were the worst id ever encountered. To say they were grotty is an understatement with human waste scattered everywhere eg body hair blocking the drains. I lost count of the number of holes in walls I spotted I can only surmise they rely on their customers to be so stoned that they simply arent bothered. Yes it is a central location that is the only thing it has to offer,personally if you have a choice avoid this flea bitten hotel like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not safe- robberies!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December 2005. While I was sleeping a someone with a knife slipped the lock on my room door and stole my jacket, wallet, mobile phone and camera. The knife was on the floor of my room when I woke up. I lost almost Â£1000 worth of property.Amsterdam police were very helpful. The thief must have been a guest or a member of the hotel staff since this was after midnight when the hotel was locked. The hotel could not have cared less. First they ignored four emails, then they claimed that they say on their webiste that there are no security facilities- this is not true. DO NOT USE THIS HOTEL, YOU WILL BE ROBBED AND THE HOTEL DON'T CARE.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant value for money and great location”
Reviews.Author: jeniheni
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel and then read reviews of it, so I had prepared myself for the worse. After a bit of a struggle finding the place (due to our stupidity rather than it being hard to find) I was surprised by the room. One good thing about all these negative reviews is that they make it hard for the place to be below your expectations. The room was clean, on-suite (wasn't expecting that) very light and even had a balcony with inclusive beer (left behind by previous guests). The central heating worked great for a winter stay, the room was always cosy. TV in the room with music channels including lots of dutch hip hop (interesting). It's in a great location walking distance from loads of great coffee shops and easy access to trams and centraal station. Only downside would be the steep stairs, but you get use to this pretty quickly. We were on the third floor and pretty soon the climb seemed normal.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean but central location!”
Reviews.Author: TomDani
Reviews.Content: Quentin Arrive: this hotel is in an nice street with many shops, coffee shops and you can reach the central station by walking in 5 minutes. Rooms are not so clean, old furniture, the lights are partly burned. We had not to share bath facilities, this was ok! If you want to stay 1 - 2 nights in Amsterdam, it is ok, but I think it is possible to find another hotels in this price category which are cleaner... I would book there again, if this were the last possibility!

Reviews.Title: “Dump ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 8 guys on a stag night, expecting a basic, no frills room, but the accomodation turned out to be a night mare. The room was very very dirty: 4 guys all in a small room in bunk beds. We think the original carpet colour was blue, but it was black and sticky when we were there. You would def. not take your shoes off and walk around. Dirty towels, beds and curtains which fell apart at the touch. Window rattled in its frame all night. 1 bathroom/shower room per floor both very dirty: you were cleaner just not washing. Only send you're worst enemies here. You have been warned!! DUMP DUMP DUMP Amsterdam a great city to visit, but this hotel would be a disgrace in any city.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay if you're going out a lot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you go to Amsterdam, then you want to go out a lot. Well, this hotel encourages that. The rooms are basic, but dirty. The stairs would challenge James Bond, even if Q has sorted him out with some new clever gadgetry. There were 4 lads in our room...sharing bunk beds...bunk beds in a hotel?! What's that about? But then we did have access to a balcony in our room. The staff were generally friendly and they did cater for groups returning from town a little worse for wear, with a pool table in the reception area, happy to sell cheap beers, no problems with smoking, etc and kept it open until the last man standing, and didnâ€™t mind if the party carried on (except for noise understandably). I donâ€™t think I'll rush back, I prefer establishments with concealed wiring, where you can walk around without shoes on, but if your plan is to embrace Amsterdam, you shouldnâ€™t be in your hotel room much anyway now should you. Fine for stag do's, not so great from a romantic weekend away with the mrs. More hostel and hotel, but that was reflected in the price, with generally easygoing attitude of staff and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient dump with dodgy staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very basic and quite dirty, but for the price I can't really complain. The steep stairs and the wiring in the rooms were obvious health hazards but luckily all fourteen drunken stag nighters survived pretty much intact. When we first arrived it transpired that they did not have enough rooms for us, and they still tried to argue the toss despite me showing the confirmation details of the bookings I had made some months ago. Were it not for the fact I am very determined and skilled in calm negotiation we might have been fobbed off. The girl on the desk when we first arrived was pleasant and helpful, but her male colleague who was there the second night was really funny with us even though we were all well behaved. The guy was surly, rude and unhelpful, which is totally out of order regardless of the cost. The location of the hotel was ideal because it is easy to find from the rail station, about five minutes stroll from all the action, but still far enough away to be fairly quiet in the small hours.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi i stayed at the arrive for 4 days.When we arrived at the hotel the staff were teriffic very friendly and helpful however the room was very average no room service in the 4 days we were there wardrobe doors hanging off .bathroom no plugs'shower curtain ripped'. We were 3 lads so didnt spend much time there in my opnion you pay for what you get paid 350 euros for 4 nights.Great location central to everything

Reviews.Title: “Warning,Fleabag hotel”
Reviews.Author: AKmom
Reviews.Content: I reserved this room expecting a basic no frills room. It was a nightmare. The carpets were dirty and smelled of vomit. The curtains were torn. The shower curtain was covered with mold. I went down and complained so they showed us a different room that was not much better. We checked out immediately but they would not refund my money that I prepaid. They are still saying we stayed there when we did not and the front desk person knows this. They are a very unscrupulous outfit.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July 2004 - I was expecting somewhere reasonably basic, but I was not prepared for what we encountered. Our room had less atmosphere than a prison cell, with bare walls and no window save for a tiny one in the top corner of the wall which was too high to see out of. The bathrooms on our floor were both filthy and out of order for the entire time we stayed (3 days) and the ones on the next floor down were also filthy and only one had working light. It was truly horrible and put a real dampener on our trip to the otherwise beautiful Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “qu. arrive review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: friendly staff and idealy located not far from central stat, 10min walk, and near the busy city center and all its attractions red light included!(very important!)i found the rooms very small as there was a group of 8 of us crammed into 2 small 4 bed rooms so we were led to assume, which were actually old bunkbeds. it was very hot no air cond, no en suite bathroom facilities, i had to go to the floor below me to take a shower which is a nuscience. its an ok place if your not too fussy! and looking for a cheap place, nice staff too

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Quintin Arrive Hotel, near Centraal Station. The room was very small, and the shared shower flooded up to your ankles. Other than that the location was great, many coffeeshops right outside the hotel door. Also just a 3 minute walk from Centraal Station. I'd stay there again if I'm alone, but only if they fix the shared batroom.

HotelInfo.Name: Quentin Arrive Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Haarlemmerstraat 65, Amsterdam 1013 EL, The Netherlands
